text:
I’m having trouble getting my Italian bread to rise in the oven. The recipe doesn’t call for steam. How often do you use steam in your recipes and have you noticed a big difference between using it and not?
I’m a beginner so it could be a number of issues but I thought I’d start here to get a general idea of steam’s importance.
I've been baking bread every week for the last 2.5 years. Usually I use steam, but sometimes I don't, and I've not noticed any difference.
Thanks for the reply. I’ve upgraded the flour and I think my kneading is ok. Yeast seems to be healthy. I need to pay closer attention to the proofing step next.

I’m quite the fan of a spray of water in a mist a couple of times during the cook. I think it helps the crust. 
For steam, certainly helps when doing sour dough imo
Maybe share your recipe and we can problem solve with you
Thank you! It is the King Arthur Italian 101 recipe. I haven’t deviated from the directions.
I made Challah and I like it
Do you have a recipe you could share on how to make it? Looks great!

Oh yes, I used this one : king Arthur no knead challah
The second load looks even better, I'll post a pic when I'm back home.
